page.title: 13BEVERTON FARM
page.content: He still has quite a large vegetable garden, we saw superb rhubarb, potatoes, pears etc and he told me that he usually makes his own jam and sometimes wine. He has some jam left from 1983. He used to exchange rhubarb for trout caught by a fisherman in Clatworthy reservoir but he has not seen him this year. It seemed to be a case of swapping the trout and rhubarb over the hedge when the fisherman passed! In winters when it snows he does get cut off but his new neighbours who have been there three years have taken him out to Wiveliscombe in their range rover. In the evenings he will read and usually goes to bed about 9.00pm, although he says he does not sleep too well.
